caption.p: Summary of clinical studies investigating proposed treatments of COVID-19.

tr.td: LPV/ RTV (400 mg/100 mg) orally b.i.d. plus standard care for 14 days.
No benefit was observed with LPV/ RTV beyond standard care treatment.
≥18years, confirmed COVID-19 cases, without Invasive ventilation. (n = 33)
Umifenovir (Arbidol®) (200 mg/ 8 h) plus LPV/ RTV (400 mg/100 mg) for 5–21 days.
Oral LPV/ RTV only for 5–21 days.
Better clinical, radiological and laboratorial (RT-PCR negativity) response was observed in the (Umifenovir + lPV/ RTV) group.
Hospitalized confirmed COVID-19 cases with O 2 saturation ≤ 94% or receiving O 2 support. (n = 61)
Remdesivir (200 mg IV. On D1 then 100 mg daily) total duration: 10 days.
Clinical improvement was observed in 68 % of patients. Total mortality rate was 13 %.
HCQ (400 mg / day) for 5 days plus conventional treatments.
Duration from hospitalization to COVID-19 nucleic acid negativity, clinical improvement, and radiological changes were comparable with the control group.
HCQ significantly shortened TTCR and promote the absorption of pneumonia.
HCQ sulfate orally (200 mg t.i.d./day) for ten days
HCQ was significantly associated with viral load reduction/disappearance in COVID-19 patients and azithromycin reinforced its effect.
-Six patients received Azithromycin (500 mg) on D1 followed by (250 mg /day) the next four days.
HCQ sulfate orally (200 mg t.i.d./day) for ten days plus Azithromycin (500 mg on D1 followed by 250 mg/ day) for the next four days.
Rapid fall of viral load (93 % negative PCR at D8). Virus cultures from respiratory samples were negative in 97.5 % patients at D5.
HCQ (1200 mg/day for 3 days, then 800 mg/day) total duration: 2−3 weeks for mild/moderate or severe patients, respectively.
HCQ did not result in a higher negative conversion rate, but more clinical improvement than the control group was observed.
All patients had clinical, radiological and laboratory (LYM and CRP level) improvement.
Three patients had another 400 mg within 12 h.
Confirmed COVID-19 pneumonia cases with ARDS. (n = 21)
Siltuximab IV. (11 mg /kg /day) over 1 h plus standard treatment.
Potential role in improving the clinical condition (33 % of patients improved, and 43 % stabilized, while 24 % had worsening in condition.
Confirmed critically ill COVID-19 cases on mechanical ventilation. with (n = 5)
Convalescent plasma (400 mL) with a SARS-CoV-2 specific antibody (IgG). b
Clinical improvement was reported in all patients.
Viral loads became negative within 12 days after transfusion.
Patients who failed to respond to low-dose CS (40−80 mg/day) and IVIG (10 g/day). (n = 3)
CS (160 mg/day) plus IVIG (20 g/d). c
Moderate dose of CS + IVIG reversed the continued deterioration of COVID-19 patients who failed to respond to the low-dose therapy.

fn.p: Abbreviations: n: number, LPV/ RTV: Lopinavir/Ritonavir, b.i.d.: Twice daily, h: Hour, O 2: oxygen, CQ /HCQ: Hydroxychloroquine, TTCR: Time to clinical recovery, D: Day, PCR: Polymerase chain reaction, IV: Intravenous, LYM: Lymphocytes, CRP: C-reactive protein, CS: Corticosteroids, IVIG: Intravenous Immunoglobulins.

fn.label: a
fn.p: Patients also received standard care including Lopinavir, methylprednisolone, and oxygen therapy.

fn.label: b
fn.p: All patients received antiviral agents and methylprednisolone.

fn.label: c
fn.p: Patients also received, as required, oxygen therapy, antiviral treatment, antibiotic treatment, extracorporeal membrane oxygenation (ECMO), and continuous renal replacement therapy (CRRT).
